subject: Programming
title: The Boeing 737 MAX Crisis
description: A quick, practical guide to The Boeing 737 MAX Crisis.

hook.text: Two brand-new Boeing 737 MAX planes crashed within five months, killing 346 people.

buildup.text: A software system called MCAS was designed to prevent stalls by pushing the nose down.

discovery.text: MCAS relied on a single sensor. When that sensor failed, it forced the plane into a dive.

twist.text: Pilots weren't told MCAS existed. They fought a system they didn't know was controlling the plane.

climax.text: The crashes exposed how cost-cutting in software testing can have fatal consequences.

punchline.text: Hidden software with no redundancy killed 346 people.

quiz.question: What was the critical flaw in the Boeing 737 MAX's MCAS system?
options: It relied on a single sensor
It couldn't connect to the internet
